title: Telegraph Travel Awards 2015/16: win a £45,000 villa stay in the Bahamas
text: Enjoy four nights on the ultimate Bahamas holiday in an ultra-luxury private three-bedroom villa at the iconic One&Only Ocean Club resort ( oneandonlyresorts.com ). Fly in style with business class flights courtesy of luxury tour operator Elegant Resorts ( elegantresorts.co.uk ). Prize also includes breakfast and Bahamas round-trip airport transfers. How to enter Follow this link to tell us about your favourite travel companies and destinations - and to enter the draw for one of 27 prizes . You will need to leave your name, telephone number and a valid email address. See here for full terms and conditions . The prize One&Only Resorts ( oneandonlyresorts.com ) and luxury travel pioneers Elegant Resorts (01244 897 513 / elegantresorts.co.uk ) are offering you the chance to win the ultimate Bahamas four-night holiday in a luxurious three bedroom villa at the iconic One&Only Ocean Club resort with return business class flights. Long recognized as one of the world’s most exclusive resorts, One&Only Ocean Club in The Bahamas is renowned for its legendary sophistication and elegance. This November, the resort will boast completely renovated and expanded guest rooms and suites and a sophisticated new beachfront pool and restaurant experience, raising the bar in the Bahamas. All One&Only resorts offer an incredible opportunity to experience privacy and exclusivity and the villa at One&Only Ocean Club is the ultimate experience. Offering generous living areas for family and friends, a dedicated butler to quietly attend to your needs 24 hours a day and dedicated household and culinary staff. Our prize winner will enjoy indulging in the private three-bedroom villa at One&Only Ocean Club. This elegant island home has a British Colonial ambience with vaulted ceilings, gentle fans and hand-carved mahogany furnishings. Accommodation includes two master bedrooms with king sized beds and a third bedroom with two queen sized beds. Jetted tubs and glass-enclosed indoor/outdoor rain showers open to a secluded sun deck, outdoor terraces and lounges. An entertainment room has spectacular sea views and an infinity-edge pool transitions seamlessly into the vast blue horizon. Villa guests will enjoy daily full breakfast served in their villa, complimentary evening canapés, a personal golf cart, a full service kitchen and a private chef for hire. This autumn, One&Only Ocean Club will also debut all new beautifully appointed and expanded guest rooms and suites in the newly designed Hartford Wing. Each guest room is increasing in size offering an expansive terrace or balcony with views of the ocean and lush resort gardens. In addition, each room will undergo a complete restyling including new furnishings, fabrics and colour schemes that amplify the distinctive palette of The Bahamas, as well as completely transformed bathrooms. Once complete, a stunning new shoreline infinity edge beach front pool will be perched overlooking the white sand beach and turquoise sea beyond. A new bar and grill will invite guests to enjoy a relaxing lunch without ever leaving the comfort of their daybed. The resort will retain what guests have always loved – a sense of exclusive privacy in a relaxed setting with a beachfront unsurpassed in The Bahamas. The prize providers One&Only Ocean Club was formerly a private estate and boasts utterly romantic gardens modelled on Versailles. In the 1960s it became an exclusive hideaway for the world’s rich and famous with visitors such as William Randolph Hearst and Zsa Zsa Gabor and is still a favourite amongst the Hollywood A list today. One&Only Ocean Club’s incredible location under the cerulean blue of an endless Bahamian sky means it has also been chosen as the location for films ranging from James Bond Casino Royale to the Wolf of Wall Street to The Other Woman. Enjoy this holiday with your arrangements carefully taken care of by luxury travel pioneers Elegant Resorts whose equally legendary client service means your ultimate luxury Bahamas holiday will be perfectly suited to your needs. The Elegant Resorts team are experts in the field of tailor-making luxury itineraries and experiences to the finest hotels and resorts worldwide and this commitment to excellence determines why readers of the Telegraph have consistently voted them 'Best Small Tour Operator' at the Ultra Telegraph Awards. One&Only Resorts and Elegant Resorts The ultimate luxury Bahamas holiday for two will see you stay for four nights in an exclusive private three-bedroom villa at the glamourous One&Only Ocean Club ( oneandonlyresorts.com ), including breakfast for two, Bahamas airport transfers and return business-class flights arranged by Elegant Resorts ( elegantresorts.co.uk ). Black-out dates will apply including all major holidays and are subject to availability. One&Only privacy policy Only participants who complete the full questionnaire will be entered into this prize draw to win one of the prizes, as described in the appendix to these terms and conditions below. This prize draw is open to residents of the UK, Channel Islands and the Isle of Man aged 18 years or over, except employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited, Elegant Resorts or One&Only their families, agents or anyone else professionally associated with the draw. Details of how to enter form part of the terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the competitor agrees to abide by these rules. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. The Promoter reserves the right to modify the Promotion at any time without prior notice. Entries must be submitted via www.telegraph.co.uk/travelawards and entry is restricted to one per person. Late, illegible, incomplete, defaced or corrupt entries, or entries sent through agencies and third parties, will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of sending will not be accepted as proof of receipt. Once submitted, entries cannot be amended in any way. The winners will be drawn at random from all entries received by the closing date. The winners’ names and counties can be obtained by sending a sae to Telegraph Travel Awards Prize Draw Winners, Advertising Marketing, Telegraph Media Group, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT between TBD and TBD. All entries must be received by midnight on TBD. The winners will be contacted by 5pm on TBD and will be required to confirm acceptance of their prize by 5pm on TBD. Should the Promoter be unable to contact a winner, or should a winner be unable to confirm their acceptance of the prize within these deadlines, the Promoter reserves the right to award the prize to an alternative winner, drawn in accordance with these terms and conditions. The Promoter may ask the winner to provide proof of age and/or country of residence. TBD winners will each receive one of the holidays, as described in the appendix to these terms and conditions, below. Prizes will be allocated by the Promoter and no negotiation or correspondence will be entered into over the allocation. The travel prizes exclude travel insurance, food and drink, personal expenditure and incidental costs, other than where mentioned. Where appropriate, it is the responsibility of individual winners to ensure they and their guest has a valid passport and to obtain any necessary visas and vaccinations before travelling. It is the responsibility of the winner to inform the prize provider of any wheelchair or similar access requirements for the winner and/or their companion when taking up the prize, and to adhere to any applicable health and safety guidelines. All elements of the prizes are subject to availability, non-transferable and there are no cash alternatives. Winners and guests may be required to participate in publicity. Events may occur that render the prize draw itself or the awarding of the prize impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter and accordingly the Promoter may at its absolute discretion vary or amend the promotion and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter as a result thereof. The Telegraph is responsible for the publication and adjudication of the prize draw. Provision of the travel prizes is the responsibility of the providers as listed below. Telegraphtravel
